We need to expand Medicaid for the sake of the people of Alabama, our health care providers, and our economy. We can't afford to wait any longer.

https://t.co/eo39TXfqew

I’m glad to finally see Alabama join other states by issuing a stay at home order. This will begin Saturday, April 4 at 5:00 p.m., but I encourage folks to start today. I know it’s a long road ahead of us, but we will get through this together. #SweetHomeStayHome

Folks, we are facing a health care crisis here in Alabama. I am urging our state officials to send a clear message to folks by issuing a statewide stay-at-home order, so we can beat this virus and get our economy back on track. https://t.co/EO6JmXcq6A

Join me today at 12:00 p.m. CT for a FB livestream with @DrJeanneM, the Director of Infectious Disease at @UABNews. We will be discussing the spread of COVID-19, the new symptom tracker from UAB and the recently passed relief legislation. Tune in here: https://t.co/3q7stDvcLg

Thank you to @SeemaCMS for taking action this week to enable hospitals and health care providers in Alabama and across the country to reach more people through tele-health services.

This will be a huge help for strained hospitals in Alabama.

https://t.co/X2sVsjgjvM

Make today count, folks! I know we're all stuck at home so I encourage you to fill out the 2020 Census—it only takes a few minutes. Without a proper count, AL could lose a seat in Congress & federal funding. Visit https://t.co/oAkt9uNJOc to get started! #NationalCensusDay https://t.co/T0NrOdYFIG

Folks, to beat COVID-19 we’re going to need YOUR help. @UABNews has a new tracker that allows you to report your daily symptoms, which allows their team to track hotspots & help decide where to dedicate resources. It's easy to get started, visit https://t.co/PyD6xrnMlv today!

This #EqualPayDay, I am thinking of all the women fighting on the frontlines of this pandemic and working around the clock to keep our families safe. Equal pay is long past due and we must take action to close the wage gap. Equal work deserves equal pay—no question. https://t.co/8Mc4TBh4WI

I know this has been a difficult time for folks and want to make sure you have access to resources and the most up to date info on COVID-19—delivered right to your inbox. Visit https://t.co/0OC2RWMfRm to subscribe today! https://t.co/ukWJTxEBpU
Happening now! https://t.co/R0bFMpV2Yp

Even during a pandemic, home might not always be the safest place for some folks. If you or someone you know needs assistance, please don't hesitate to reach out to national, state and local resources available to help. https://t.co/LXOCPVk3oJ

Tonight, the Senate came together to pass a much stronger, bipartisan bill that will get more money to working folks, small businesses, and our health care workers on the front lines—but this won't be our last step.
 
In the meantime, take care of yourselves & each other, folks. https://t.co/uEvtdtP4hE

Today, on #NationalAgDay, I want to thank those in the agricultural industry who are ensuring continued access to food, fuel and clothing. Alabamians and folks across the United States depend on the important work you do every day. https://t.co/4jP67BwooG

Great news from @GovernorKayIvey and @AlabamaRevenue—the deadline for filing and paying state income tax has been extended from April 15 to July 15. This deferral applies to all Alabama taxpayers, trusts and estates, corporations and non-corporate tax filers. https://t.co/GgdezKb3sP

We've made a lot of progress in the last 24 hours and so today I voted to move the process forward—but make no mistake this bill needs major changes before it would earn my full support, including:
 
✔️ $$$ for our cities/counties
✔️ ️full transparency for the $500B relief fund https://t.co/3ZWqwVP8ko

Congress has a responsibility to pass a stimulus package as soon as possible, but we also have to make sure we do it right. It needs to give working folks, hospitals, cities, county governments, and small businesses the help they need. We have to do better, and do it fast.

We need a bill that does more for the working folks who are struggling the most, not no-strings bailouts for corporations. The Senate will get something done for the American people, but we need to stop wasting time on political games. https://t.co/bFTJ1Ab6IZ
I’m so proud to see schools across Alabama stepping up to be champions for our children & communities during this uncertain time: https://t.co/cScsocAbvU

We have to take bold action and think big to help our small businesses and workers. That’s I’m proposing a new Small Business Lifeline Fund as one part of the solution to keep people afloat during this crisis. https://t.co/kthHBmhwhc
The deadline for *filing* taxes has now been moved to July 15! Taxpayers now have three additional months to file AND pay their taxes with no penalties. https://t.co/by22hp9rz1

More than a million workers are expected to lose their jobs by the end of March. That's why @RepTerriSewell and I are urging @GovernorKayIvey to expand unemployment benefits for folks affected by COVID-19. We can't turn our backs on our neighbors at a time like this. https://t.co/sqF9v5RSPo

The spread of COVID-19 affects all of us. That's why it's so important that we all need to do our part to keep ourselves and our communities healthy.

https://t.co/6QITgVXfOd

I just voted to pass the 2nd round of stimulus funding to expand paid sick leave and increase food assistance. We're working on the third package now to help workers and small businesses.
 
But folks—the best thing we can do for our economy is to STAY HOME & stop the spread. https://t.co/rvQx4xDf5D

The U.S. Treasury and IRS announced that individuals can delay paying their taxes for 90 days due to the novel coronavirus. While those who owe taxes now have until July 15 to pay them, please keep in mind the filing deadline is still April 15. https://t.co/ei6c1SvTI2

RT @maxbrooksauthor: A message from me and my dad, @Melbrooks. 

#coronavirus #DontBeASpreader https://t.co/Hqhc4fFXbe

Medicare has just expanded telehealth & telemedicine, which will allow for folks to receive medical care from the comfort of their homes by phone or video at no additional costs to them. Please spread the word—this is a great option to keep people safe during this time.

Hey y’all – we all need to follow best practices, stay home, and do our part to protect others. I’m calling on the Senate to act quickly and decisively, too, to protect working families and small businesses. https://t.co/WsPmWxHkgM

I’m proud to work alongside my colleagues @SenBillCassidy, @SenTinaSmith & Sen. @SteveDaines to introduce a bill to allow Americans rapid access to the coronavirus vaccine once developed, with no cost sharing.

Read more about this bipartisan effort here: https://t.co/jUn7vEzaUv https://t.co/viId04hv9S
We’re all in this together. This may be inconvenient for folks, but it’s not a time to panic, it’s a time to work together.

If you have COVID-19 symptoms – fever, dry cough, and trouble breathing – call your health care provider before going into their office or the ER to get tested. We need to avoid overwhelming our system.
The good news is that we have an opportunity to mitigate the effects of this by doing things like washing our hands and practicing social distancing. And please stay home if you feel sick!

This coronavirus is not business as usual – it is a serious infection that has never infected humans before, and that makes us all especially vulnerable, especially if you are older than 65 or have an underlying illness.

I know a lot of y'all have a lot of questions and concerns about COVID-19, so I sat down with infectious disease expert Dr. Jeanne Marrazzo from @UABNews to try to answer some of the questions that folks may have. https://t.co/QKKnbOUy1C

I’m proud to introduce this bipartisan bill alongside @SenThomTillis, @Sen_JoeManchin & @JohnCornyn to help more people make the most of their second chance—and it's already earned support from @AlaAppleseed, @AssocNational & @bankpolicy.

Thanks to everyone who came out to my Marshall County town hall today! We had a great discussion—talking about everything from education to health care to infrastructure and most importantly, how to continue to make Alabama a great place for all our families. https://t.co/W1u0URx8C6

In the past year, I've been fortunate to visit Lee Co. four times to support the recovery effort.
 
But we can't just rebuild. I'm also working to protect lives when severe weather strikes, including increasing
storm shelters & expanding evacuation routes. https://t.co/4rqXJ8OhPF

Today we held a #coronavirus hearing to talk about how we can best mitigate this outbreak. We need to make sure folks know the signs and symptoms and that we have accurate and affordable ways to test for the virus—in cities and rural areas, alike.
 
Watch 👇 https://t.co/mwgrz0n709

It’s been 1 year since devastating tornadoes touched down in Lee County. Since then, I’ve seen firsthand this community unite to heal and rebuild. Today, we remember those we lost and recommit to rebuilding even stronger than before.
 
#BeauregardStrong #SmithsStationStrong https://t.co/CzFCGOBAKk

Hey folks—@Outdoor_Alabama just announced the dates for this year’s #redsnapper season. From May 22 to July 19, private anglers can enjoy four-day weekends open for fishing in both state and federal waters. I hope to see y’all out there! https://t.co/gFG6nRwoOb

I'm going to continue to be a partner to your work to make sure you can continue to provide a first-class education to the students you serve.

In just 2 years, we've secured *permanent* mandatory HBCU funding + a 30% increase in discretionary funding.

#HBCUSummit #FUTUREAct

There is a certain bond here that is unlike anything else. You can feel it.

HBCUs also provide a foundation upon which to build wealth for communities that have long been shut out from those opportunities. 

#HBCUSummit

Alabama has not only the *most* HBCUs, but we have the best! 

This #HBCUSummit is an opportunity to showcase their great work and talk about how we can overcome the challenges they face—together.

.@SenDougJones opens his #HBCUSummit with a message to Alabama's HBCU Presidents: What you're doing to educate Alabama's best and brightest kids just can't be overstated. Thank you!

In To Kill a Mockingbird, Atticus Finch said, “The one thing that doesn’t abide by majority rule is a person’s conscience.”

All along, my conscience has been my guide. But voting my conscience does not require courage — it simply requires doing what I know is right. https://t.co/4ijgsy3Qgi

This has been a divisive time for our country, but as this chapter of history draws to a close, one thing is clear: our country deserves better than this. We must find a way to come together and to focus on what we have in common as Americans. https://t.co/xOjNuaQ3U1
At 11:25 a.m. ET, I'll address my decision on the Senate floor.  Tune in here for a livestream of my remarks.

Senators are elected to make tough choices. We must study the facts & exercise independent judgment in keeping with our oaths.

I've studied the record for months. Unfortunately I believe the President abused his power for his own benefit.

My statement: https://t.co/uJkC497Vso

Rosa Parks, who sparked the Montgomery bus boycott, would have been 107 today. Ms. Parks paved the way for equality and demonstrated what it truly means to be courageous, even in the face of adversity. We honor her legacy by continuing to push for a more equal society every day. https://t.co/sD2YWIhBrL

Today we will determine if this is a fair and complete trial when we vote on whether or not to allow additional witnesses and documents to be admitted. And folks, I want to make this clear: the world is watching what we do. I hope my colleagues vote to do the right thing. https://t.co/eJrTWJ83JY
If it takes some time to do this the right way, so be it. This is too important for us to rush through. https://t.co/24nvTMu2ct

The President’s lawyers made some important points today that should be considered, esp. regarding obstruction.

However—they also confirmed we need to hear from firsthand witnesses that we can cross-examine to get the full truth.

My thoughts on the defense’s 1st day👇🏻 https://t.co/pe9vAgxGIU

The Constitution is only as strong as the people who swear an oath to protect it. 

We need to hear the truth, the full truth, and nothing but the truth. That is the only way to ensure a fair and complete trial. https://t.co/ulgKsl7YGN

I know I'm starting to sound like a broken record, but I practiced law for over 40 years and I just can't understand why we shouldn't be able to access witnesses and documents that we know contain relevant information. https://t.co/gV9wcvDiXg

The President himself said today that he'd like to have witnesses testify, so let's make sure he gets a full, fair, and complete trial by bringing those folks in for depositions.

Here are a few more of my thoughts from yesterday and a preview of what I'm watching for today 👇 https://t.co/tPwscYbfIq

I agree w/@SenToomey: @CommerceGov must comply w/the law and release this report. It has yet to explain how Alabama-made cars are a nat'l security threat.
